segments.text: I can’t believe how calm the woman looks while the sink is overflowing.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The water is just pouring onto the floor, and she’s acting like nothing is wrong.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Her foot is already in the puddle, but she doesn’t even seem to notice.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder if she’s just really focused or if she’s ignoring it on purpose.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The dishes are stacked neatly, but the floor is a complete mess.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I think she’s going to slip and fall if she doesn’t turn off the water soon.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The children are being sneaky behind her, and she has no idea.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy is about to fall off that stool, and the girl is just waiting for a cookie.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I feel like yelling at all of them to wake up and pay attention.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The garden outside looks so peaceful, but inside, it’s pure chaos.
segments.speaker: PAR
